item.title: Traffic congestion, 8th September
item.description:
Buses from Highbury grove and traffic are prevented from moving into St Paulâ€™s road. I have been waiting over 10 minutes just for a bus to get through traffic. There needs to be a way for traffic to join easily as cars do not make space for them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Paul's Road, Highbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter Issue and Flytip, 8th September
item.description:
Every week the same thing is happening at this location on Faversham Road. This large metal wheelie bin (who does it belong to?) is left overflowing, top open, and with piles of other bags, litter, flytip left all around it. I was able to clean it up somewhat, hence it doesn't look as bad in my pictures. But before I did there was litter and bags scattered everywhere. The litter along these side roads is shockingly bad over the weekend. Whoever owns this wheelie bin is filling it up and dumping more around the base, encouraging others to litter on top. There is also a lot of flytip mixed in here too, small furniture, toys, clothes, all sorts of things.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Faversham Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bikes abandoned completely blocking footpath, 8th September
item.description:
Yet again like bikes left antisocially, completely blocking the footpath. What about disabled people in wheelchairs, how are they supposed to use the footpath? Lime and your users, can you please do something to encourage more responsible behaviour?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Petherton Road, Highbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet
